summary: Based on the provided documents, K. A. Mendenhall is mentioned in the context of FBI internal communications and responses to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC) inquiries. The documents relate to FBI mail opening operations, information requests concerning individuals on the National Security Agency (NSA) Watch List, FBI-CIA liaison activities, assessments of potential damage from disclosing information to the Senate Select Committee (SENSTUDY 75), FBI purchases of technical equipment from the CIA, and an investigation into a leak from the Church Committee involving a CIA memorandum. The documents also pertain to the FBI's response to requests from the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC) regarding superseded sections of the Manual of Instructions, electronic surveillance, and the elimination of the FBI Crime Records Division. The specific role or actions of K. A. Mendenhall are not detailed in the summaries, but their name appears in the context of these sensitive investigations and communications.
key_connections: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC)
significance: The significance of K. A. Mendenhall in the JFK assassination context cannot be determined from the provided documents. The documents relate to intelligence activities and investigations, but do not explicitly connect K. A. Mendenhall to the JFK assassination.
